metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5380 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A potential use-after-free found through fuzzing during DOM manipulation of SVG content. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 45.7, Firefox ESR < 45.7, and Firefox < 51.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5380` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

thunderbird - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
